intro: Merremia multisecta, commonly known as the multilobe morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves that give it its scientific name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found growing along riverbanks and in disturbed soils. Merremia multisecta is a climbing vine that can reach significant lengths, making it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
